title: Piltover Map: Varus' village referenced.

embed.description: Piltover is a thriving, progressive city whose power and influence is on the rise. It is Valoran's cultural center, where art, craftsmanship, trade and innovation walk hand in hand.

body:
In Varus' original lore, his village was unnamed, just known to have been the location where the ancient corruption was held.

Most people wouldn't recognize the name, Pallas, unless they read his Journal of Justice entry, in which it the thing that held the corruption was known as a 'Pit of Pallas.'I was quite hoping the village to be eventually named Pallas tbh as it sounded fitting. In Varus' lore, Pallas was destroyed by the Noxians while he was defending the temple that held the corruption. In the ensuing chaos everyone in the village was slaughtered, including his wife and child. This is what fueled Varus to become blighted by the corruption in his desire to kill every Noxian associated with his village's destruction.

I'm glad that Varus was mentioned in this map to be honest. I am also desperately waiting for your reveal to his new narrative, Jaredan. Because if even you get excited chills about it, then I know for sure you and the foundations team has something big planned for him.
